intro: Osbeckia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy osbeckia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Osbeckia hirsuta is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for garden use.
